ArticleTitle.sentence: Nuclear transcription factors that bind to elements of the IL-2 promoter.

event.clue: Nuclear transcription factors that bind to elements of the IL-2 promoter.

ArticleTitle.sentence: Induction requirements in primary human T cells.

AbstractText.sentence: Prior studies have identified several elements that contribute to the activity of the IL-2 promoter in the stimulated T cell line, Jurkat.

event.clue: Prior studies have identified several elements that contribute to the activity of the IL-2 promoter in the stimulated T cell line, Jurkat.

AbstractText.sentence: The sites and their corresponding nuclear binding factors include: NF-kappa B, AP-1, AP-3, OCT-1, and NF-AT.
The latter "nuclear factor for activated T cells" likely contributes to the tissue specificity of IL-2 gene expression.

AbstractText.sentence: Using electrophoretic mobility shift assays, we have studied these transcription factors in primary T cells from human blood to verify their presence in a physiologic setting and to identify the signals that stimulate factor activity.
